localize.text: They say the world was a place where you couldn't find happiness with your own method.
That it was a world where you had to fool yourself into thinking that fitting into a structured mold was happiness.
Nobody sought history or religion anymore. No one needed them.
Under the guise of a new technology that was needed in the world, new companies emerged using a technology called Singularity.

Production of a permanent food supply, manufacturing customized living creatures, cargo would be transported at speeds that made it seem like teleportation, AI that were realer than people, technology to preserve the present by binding time, etc...
Similar to the food chain, small companies began disappearing or were eaten by larger companies...
At some point, they were called the Wings of the World, and soon a head rose to control the Wings.
People started to find their purpose for existence from the Wings.
However, the truth was, everyone was slowly melting like the wings of Icarus.
It seems they’re encouraging development of the world for the better, but their nature is same as ours.
There’s always a price to pay. The price that we pay is the shame of the Wings and the disgrace of the world and its people.
Lobotomy’s rival energy corporations aren’t that different from us. Who knows? Maybe they really are earning energy from hell as the rumors say.
For mankind, the instinct of life and death coexist.
The Wings only guided our instinct of life.
If one instinct dominated too much, the other instinct would begin to make its move slowly and unknowingly from the depths.
Soon a world where everyone wants to return to nothing will arrive.
Into the stillness of silence before mankind was born.
She who loved sunshine wanted to give hope to mankind but failed.
When the hand that only wanted to embrace with warmth was ruthlessly cut off, you clutched the void, and saw the crack between the boundaries that were never shown to others.
Left alone, you decided to instill possibilities to all mankind.
Hope and despair are intertwined in that possibility, making it impossible for anyone to know the answer.
"If all repressed things can be extracted from the earth..." You said to yourself.
In those days, you really looked terrible.
Many coworkers were worried about you and tried to comfort you, but you didn't care or listen to anything.
I guess you still needed your coworkers at some point.
Seeing as you were the one who locked them in here, barely holding onto the husks of their dead bodies...
